title: Album Page, "Modillion from the Bargello, Florence", November 7, 1887
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner of sheet: (inscribed in circle) 81/ 94; read from top to bottom: under view; (the middle space is / filled by gold mosaic); side view; Modillion to the balcony lying in the Bargello / designed by Donatello / Florence - November 7th 1887.
description: Vertical sheet tipped horizontally into binding depicting a modillion from the front and side.  The front view has a molding of small oak leaves at the top, with the long, swooping lines of a large leaf below.  The side view of the modillion is read perpendicular to the front view.  It shows the modillion has a scroll terminating in a rosette at either end.  The field above the scroll is tinted yellow and has short, intersecting lines, as if to imply a crackled surface.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Modillion from the Bargello, Florence", November 7, 1887.
November 7, 1887. Brush and watercolor, graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-151.
